column2: evelyn,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I developed a severe headache within two hours of starting this drug. It was not a migraine or due to dehydration. I kept myself hydrated knowing it was imperative to do so. In addition, I began having muscle spasms in my legs, back and neck. I also had severe dizziness. The headache lasted for two days after my procedure and the pain was a 9 on a scale of one to 10. Nothing helped the headache, including medicine given me at the procedure nor prescription meds my dr. prescribed. The muscled spasms continued for another four-five days. I was left weak for an entire week following the use of this med and had intermittent dizziness. I looked back at the ingredients of the prep and the flavor packet which was lemon. The flavor packet included maltodextrin and natural flavors. These two ingredients contain gluten. I am gluten intolerant. I realized then that I'd had an allergic reaction to the contents of the flavor packet. I was shocked that my dr. prescribed this particular prep. I was also shocked that the product didn't state that it contained gluten. As a general rule I don't eat things that are not labeled gluten-free. However, this being a prescribed drug and my dr. knowing I have an allergy to gluten, I trusted that it was OK. I will never use this product again. I suggest that the manufacturer indicate that it contains ingredients known to cause problems for gluten-sensitive people. Better still, why not try to use flavoring packets that are gluten-free?

column2: nixas, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I got the first half gallon down the night before, but with the 2nd half gallon in the morning I couldn't quit vomitting! All of this idea of it's so much better is not true!

column2: c_kemeza, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this was awful!  I had chills & a severe headache by the time I went in for my colonoscopy, It's taken me 4 days to recover from dehydration, chills, vomitting, and my headache.  I will never take Golytely  again.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a very good experience with "Go-Lightly" and was happy that I went this route compared to the pill only approach.  It's much less expensive than the pills, you drink about the same massive amounts of fluid either way and the supposed bad taste was easily overcome with a little crystal light.  Was back to normal immediately after the procedure.  I ate a light breakfast the morning before the procedure (which occured the next morning at around 9 am)and fasted until starting the Golytely around 6 pm.  Was cleaned out by bed time and slept normally that night.  Overall, not as bad a situation as I expected, this being my first colonoscopy.

column2: unicornpookie@hotmail.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: While this works/does it's job, it also has for me, wicked side effects.  I was throwing up green half way through the "jug" of stuff.  :o(   Other than that, it was alright.  Now I need to take the stuff again and wondering if I can mix it with Gateraid or Powerade instead of water. And yeah, it is a little better if it's cold.

column2: mills63044, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son has an extra foot fo colon, and has been having bowel problems for years. He has had to have an NG tube a few times to use this medicine. It's horrible, but it definately works. Saved his life a couple of times. For people with chronic bowel and/or constipation problems, I recommend Amitiza. My son has been on it for over a year and has not required any more clean-outs.

column2: jaclyn , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: well,I have endometriosis that i am gettingremoved oh my goodness it taste horrible.but you got to do what you got to do. If you can keep from gaging you'll do fine my stomach feels really full its been 45 minutesim waiting but i feel like its fixing to work.I'll I have to say is good luck for who ever has to take this terrible tasteing medicine.

column2: Ijustwantpeace,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I really needed help going to the bathroom. I am only 35. Nothing seemed to work, stool softeners, laxatives, eating more fiber, nothing. My doctor took an X-ray and found that I was severely "stopped up". I have never been this stopped up in my life. Now I think that it would have been better to have stayed stopped up than go through he nightmare that is called GoLytely. First of all, there is nothing "lyte" or light about it. It is the strongest laxative known to man. It does not make you have regular BM's, Oh no, it gives you liquid poo instead, and LOTS OF IT! It was pretty much like peeing poo. It did clean out my bowels, but now I am experiencing extreme gassiness and cramping in my stomach that is not allowing me to sleep. I keep on eating, thinking I might be hungry, but I think it is only making it worse. I can't leave the house because I might poo in my pants while just checking the mail! My stomach is gurgling at this very moment and you can actually hear it from 10 feet away and see the flesh ripple. I took this concoction at 10:00 A.M. and it is now 12:00 at night and I am not able to sleep due to the discomfort I am experiencing. I think next time, although I pray to God that there is NOT a next time, but if there is because God is cursing me, I will try every other avenue before taking this medicine. I will even try an enema, an operation, committing myself to a convent and praying to God to release me from constipation. Am I being overly dramatic? If you have been extremely constipated and have gone through the torture that is called Golytly , you will think not. THE END.

column2: Simeon, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug interacted badly with Glucosamine Condoritin w/MSM.  It inflamed by upper respiratory which caused tremendous pain from shoulder to shoulder.  The severe pain went away but I had shortness of breath for the next three days.

column2: lucylou, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had no bowel movement in 2 days  while I have been using this treatment.

column2: kenz, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After an air trip to Hawaii had a pain in my left upper abdomen area. Painful bending foward, etc. and touch sensitive on the skin at one point. At doctor's office there were not proper bowel sounds.  Ultrasound showed only  colon accumulation.  Dr. gave golytely presc.  Was like a miracle,also reduced my constipation problems. Causes runs one day.  Worth that!Cleared 78 yrs accum.

column2: kim_wells85, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is the second time I have had to take this medicine.  First time for a bowel resectioning and this time for not having a BM in 11 days at 5 1/2 months pregnant.  Does have a terrible taste; however, that is the only truely negative thing about this medicine.

column2: MNguy, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My wife used this product as prep for colon cancer surgery the following day.  The tumor was almost completely blocking her colon.  When she had the colonoscopy which found the tumor the doctor was not even able to get the scope through the opening.About an hour after starting to drink the vile stuff my wife became violently ill.  She vomited repeatedly and became almost delirious.  I called 911 and she was taken by ambulance to a hospital.A couple days later as I was getting ready to throw out the remains of the GoLYTELY I found and peeled off a very well disguised "package insert".  It said that "GoLYTELY is contraindicated in patients with gastrointestinal obstruction".I really question why she was told to use that product and why the product did not display the peel off tag with it's warning more clearly.  My wife had used GoLYTELY before her colonoscopy and while it made her nauseous she did not vomit or have the extreme reaction she did before the surgery.Emergency staff seemed to think the difference was because the blockage had become even worse since the colonoscopy and because of dehydration since my wife by that time had been on a liquid only diet for about three weeks.Under normal conditions it is probably an acceptable product.  But DO NOT USE IT if you know or have reason to believe you have an obstructed colon!

column2: william, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The ending results were interesting in that the liquid was clear, but yellow. I don't quite understand that one.

column2: Nanajoy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started Golytely at 6PM. I drank 8 ozs every 15 minutes for the first hour.  It started working within 30 minutes. I was feeling very full after the first hour so I started drinking 8 ozs every 30 minutes until I had finished 10 glasses by 10:00PM. This medication worked very well for me. I was up about every 20 minutes until 1:00AM. Then it slowed down to about once an hour. The colonoscopy was at 8:30AM. Doctor said everything looked great.  The worst part about the Golytely is the taste. I used a flavor packet and it did help a little.

column2: 35-44 Male
column9: It definately works, if you can get by the gagging from the vile taste. Next time I will ask about Nulytely. It is supose to be the same thing, just taste better.

column2: bobi1953, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had a fever since the hour I started taking it.  Constant chills and dizziness.  This has been going on for 5 days now, and it dosen't want to stop.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is a necessary evil in preparing for a colonoscopy.  I was diagnosed with colon cancer last year and believe me this medication is NOTHING compared to chemotherapy.  Yes its horrible but compared to the alternative of more surgery and more chemotherapy......I will glady drink this once a year.

column2: JULISANDYSMOM, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This product is VILE! Unlike the explanation given on this site, liquid stools began in less than 10 minutes from first inbibing this foul liquid. It continued regularly as quickly as I could ingest it.  Supposedly it is possible that one will eventually see "clear" stools. My own experience was painful in the abdomen, and severely orangey yellow liquid. YUCK!!!
